lines.text:
[to the Kid, rosponding to his challenge]
You can't battle me, son. You still wet behind the ears!
Wet behind the ears!
Psyche!
You still got the price tag on ya.
Yount!
Don't you know who I am?
Yount, yount!
I wrote the book!
Yount, yount, yount!
I cook young brothers like you and...
[spits]
... spit out the seeds!

[a member stomps the floor]
Mmm!
I don't need you; I'm the one YOU need.
YOU need!
I took you in... when you was down and out!
Down and out!
I gave you money...
Mmm?
Money!
Mmm!
And now you think YOU got clout? You can't battle me, baby! I'll kick yo' little ass and have you runnin' home to mama, good-and-plenty fast!
If you want something done right, hire good people to do it for you!

[after singing a fake fanfare when Morris arrives at the club]
The King has arrived!
[everyone laughs]
Tevin! Put that money down!
But Mom, there's a couple of 20's in here!
Oh! Then pick it up! Pick it all up!
Let me give you a piece of good advice, & I do get paid for counseling!
[first lines]
Are there really angels, or are they just in our minds? It all comes out in the wash... in time.
You can't fight fire with fire. When a man screams, you must learn to whisper.
Jerome... Please tell this woman her account's overdrawn at my bank.
Robin, stop asking for so much money!
Stop asking for money? Boy, I own a part of this joint! If it weren't for my daddy's money, y'all niggas would still be shootin' dice down at the Glam Slam! Shit, you've got some nerve talkin'...
Robin... Honey... Sweetheart... Baby, please! You see this?
[turns and aims his rear end to Robin, patting it twice]
Take a week off and kiss it all!

[as the Time sings "Release It", entertaining the Glam Slam's crowd and outperforming the Kid's band]
Damn, this is embarrassing!
Man, they're doggin' us at our own club!
I told you, Kid, you shoulda let me rap!
Damn, this is embarrassing!
It's just around the corner.
Name?
Aura.
Mmm... Lovely! Where'd you get that ass?
Same place you got your manners.
Jerome... where'd I get my manners?
Same place she got that ass.
And where was that?
Mama.
That's right, baby. Yo' mama!
Seven corners, two souls fight. One wants money, one wants light. Without peace, without love, nothing's ever gonna turn out right.
[last lines]
Morris... turn out the lights.
You know, this plant looks kinda... thirsty.

[singing]
A, B, C, D, E, F, G... H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O...

[unzips his pants and urinates on the plant]
P!
So what's up with you and this half-and-half bitch? Am I number one, or number two? Tell me now, 'cause I really don't have time for this shit!
You better put some treble on that tone, or you're gonna be pullin' some Stacy Adams out yo' ass!

[pursuing Morris, Jerome and Aura]
Pull over, boy!
Man, look! The fool's following us! Rat patrol!
Have you ever been to Morris' club? It's really nice.
On the outside, it's really nice. It's the inside I got a problem with.
Maybe what I need is a sign. A green light that says, "It's okay. It's okay to continue. Somebody's up there listening." But it' hard to see green...
[paints a green streak on his wall]
... when there's so much blue.
[paints a blue streak over the green]

[Kid sits next to Aura with a heart-shaped notepad, draws a Hangman's noose and four spaces]
A.
[smiles and shakes his head, draws a circle for a head]
B.
[draws a stick for a torso]
C.
[draws two legs]
D.
[draws two arms, a smile on the head, and fills in the four spaces with the letters M-I-N-E. Points to Aura, then points to the word "mine"]
No, baby...
[slowly raises her arm and points to the sky]
... His.

[after the Kid and his band perform "tick, tick, bang" in front of the Pandemonium]
Whoever battles me... you better bring an army!
Better bring an army, sho'nuff!
[laughing all the way back into the Pandemonium]
Let me give you two a piece of good advice, and I do get paid for counseling!
Just sign over the club, Melody, or we'll wreck it, too.

Who are you, running around telling people what to do? You know, I've been laying low respecting Billy's dying wishes. But when you start bogarting me and George? You messin' with the food on our dishes!
Ain't that a shame?

[to a drunken Aura, before the take her for a ride]
Sexiness to the left of you...
Sexiness to the right!
It's all about the pimp sandwich tonight!
[Morris and Jerome cackle]
